text: hello and welcome to the five minute
overview of well architected
my name is melissa and i'm a startup
solutions architect here at aws
together with you i'll be diving deep
today into the well architected console
tool and the api
before diving into the tool let's
quickly recap what the well architected
review is
well architected reviews give you a
consistent approach to evaluate
architectures and implement scalable
designs it's comprised of five pillars
operational excellence security
reliability
performance efficiency and cost
optimization
and each pillar contains a set of
foundational questions to evaluate how
well your architecture
aligns with cloud best practices to
learn more about each individual pillar
please watch the other videos in our
series
today we'll be learning how to use the
well architected console tool and the
api
so you can conduct well architected
reviews independently
the well architected console tool is a
self-guided tool for you to review your
workloads against the five pillars
you can compare your environment to
define best practices get a list of high
and medium risk issues in your workload
and get recommendations for how to
remediate those issues
make sure to involve all stakeholders
related to the workloads in the review
there's a few definitions you should
know before you use the tool
the first is workload a workload is a
collection of resources and code that
delivers business value
like a customer-facing application or a
back-end process
this can be a subset of resources in a
single account or it could be a
collection of multiple resources
spanning multiple accounts
milestones represent the state of a
workload at a particular point in time
medium risk issues or mris and high-risk
issues or hris are architectural choices
that aws has found might result in
negative or significantly negative
impact on business
including organization operations and
assets
this next diagram will show how
workloads milestones and
issues all relate to each other when you
conduct a well-architected review you
should scope the review to a single
workload instead of multiple workloads
you can choose to apply lenses to your
review which extend the guidance offered
by the well-architected review to
specific industry and technology domains
such as machine learning or financial
services
you'll save your first milestone after
you complete your first review
at the end of your review you'll want to
work on remediating these findings and
prioritizing remediations based on risk
category
as you conduct reviews regularly you'll
also want to save a milestone each time
you make improvements to a workload
workload reviews should be conducted
during key milestones and the product
life cycle
such as early on in the design phase to
avoid one-way doors
before a go live date or when you add
new features and change technology
implementations
now let's take a look at how to use the
console tool
first define your workload
select any additional lenses you want to
apply lenses focus on a specific
workload type and provide additional
guidance scope to that particular lens
here you can begin your review navigate
the pillars from the left-hand sidebar
and answer each
question within each pillar check the
boxes if your workload satisfies the
condition
for more details on what a question or
condition means click the info link
reviews can take anywhere from a few to
several hours depending on the scope you
defined for your workload
when you're finished you can generate a
report that summarizes the mris and hris
found in your workloads along with
specific guidance on how to remediate
those issues
in addition to the console tool we now
offer an api that allows you to extend
well architected functionality
by automating best practices detection
you can integrate your well architected
data into centralized reporting
collect metrics on milestones review
workloads create and update reviews and
more
one example of api usage is to use it to
build custom reports of well architected
reviews
you can use the api to aggregate the
data of workload reviews into a central
data lake repository
then use a business intelligence tool
like quicksite to perform centralized
reporting
this method helps teams analyze their
organization's well-architected maturity
across
multiple aws accounts and workloads
while maintaining visibility of high
risk issues
thank you for watching this episode on
the well architected console tool
and the api we recommend that you
conduct well architected reviews
regularly on your workloads
you can conduct reviews with your
